message.content: cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE. This paper proposes a method for generating titles for unstructured text documents using a deep neural network trained on document-title pairs with decomposable titles. This approach involves breaking down the title into a subset of the vocabulary of the document, which is a common technique in natural language processing and machine learning. Given the focus on language processing and machine learning, the most likely sub-categories are cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the use of a deep neural network suggests a focus on machine learning, which could also place this paper in the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. The paper also deals with information retrieval and natural language generation, which could place it in the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category. Finally, the use of neural networks for generating headlines could also place this paper in the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category.
